title: In Telangana, illicit narcotics business behind an ordinary facade
content: From a school building in Bowenpally to a chemical unit in Cherlapalli, narcotics operations functioned undisturbed for months and years in different parts of Hyderabad, shielded by familiarity and public trust. This strategy of hiding in plain sight, according to investigators, blunts suspicion, delays intelligence gathering and allows criminal economies to expand quietly.¬†Naveen Kumar¬†delves into the networks, methods and audacity of these hidden hubs

title: In Haryana, provocative pop picks guns and goons

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs link to a key amendment to the Constitution on freedom of press, expression

The Constitution had to be amended in the light of the landmark judgment. Parliament adopted the amendment Bill, with 246 members voting in favour and 14 against

title: Six decades of Blue Cross: from humble beginnings to setting the standard for animal welfare

In 1959, Captain V. Sundaram brought home two stranded puppies he found on a flooded street¬†near his house at T. Nagar.

title: Centre Notifies Draft Rules For Social Security Of Gig Workers. Details Here
content: To be eligible for social security benefits such as health, life and personal accident insurance, gig workers will have to be engaged with a single aggregator for at least 90 days.

title: Indian-Origin Cab Driver Picks Up Two Passengers, Drops 3 To Hospital
content: An Indian-origin cab driver who picked up a couple, including a pregnant woman, as passengers, delivered three people safely to a hospital on a cold winter night, with the female giving birth on board, local media reported.

title: Railway Minister  Witnesses Final Bullet Train Tunnel Breakthrough In Maharahstra
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday virtually witnessed the final breakthrough of a 1.5-km-long mountain tunnel of the bullet train project in Maharashtra's Palghar district from Rail Bhawan in New Delhi.

title: 'Locked & loaded': Trump issues stark warning to Iran as protests rage; vows to ‚Äòrescue‚Äô protesters
content: Former US President Donald Trump has issued a stern warning to Iran, vowing American intervention if peaceful protesters are violently suppressed.  This comes as widespread demonstrations, fueled by economic hardship and soaring inflation, grip the nation.  Protesters are voicing strong dissent against the government, with chants targeting top leadership, marking the most significant unrest since 2022.

title: 'India has right to defend': Jaishankar hits out at 'bad neighbours' ‚Äî what he said on neighbourhood policy
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar stated India faces challenges from "bad neighbours," implicitly referencing Pakistan, and asserted the nation's right to self-defense against persistent terrorism. He emphasized India's strategic autonomy, dismissing external mediation and highlighting that continued hostility undermines goodwill, impacting pacts like the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: 'New York vich munda renda‚Äô: Babbuliciousperforms at Mamdani's oath ceremony - Watch
content: New York City's first Muslim Mayor, Zohran Mamdani, made history with a vibrant subway oath ceremony featuring a viral Punjabi music performance.  Mamdani, known for his outreach to the South Asian diaspora, danced with his wife to a popular track, captivating attendees and sparking widespread social media excitement. This event underscores his commitment to celebrating diverse cultural roots.

title: Indore water row: 10 dead, over 1,000 affected; reports flag 'presence of bacteria' - key findings
content: A severe diarrhoea outbreak has struck Bhagirathpura in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. Contaminated drinking water has caused at least 10 deaths and sickened over 1,400 residents. Officials identified a leakage in the main water pipeline near a police outpost, leading to sewage contamination. Residents are now fearful of the water supply, even from tankers.

title: Kashmir landslide: Massive rocks crash onto NH-1 near Baramulla; motorists run for cover
content: A massive landslide on the Srinagar‚ÄìBaramulla‚ÄìUri highway disrupted traffic on Friday morning. The incident occurred on the Baramulla stretch of NH-1 amidst severe cold wave conditions and snowfall in higher reaches. The region is currently experiencing Chilla-e-Kalan, a period of intense winter.

title: ChatGPT creator warns: AI models getting dangerous; OpenAI needs safety boss
content: OpenAI's Sam Altman seeks a high-stakes 'Head of Preparedness' to address AI's growing security risks and mental health impacts. The company faces lawsuits over alleged harm caused by ChatGPT, while its safety teams have been disbanded. This new role aims to balance rapid AI advancement with crucial safeguards, a challenging task given the technology's unprecedented capabilities and potential dangers.

title: From controversial Nazi wave gesture to Punjabi groove: Viral moments from Mamdani‚Äôs oath ceremony
content: Zohran Mamdani made history as New York City's first South Asian and Muslim mayor, sworn in at a subway station. His inauguration sparked viral moments, including a debated hand gesture, a heartfelt tribute to his "Kampala to Delhi" roots, and a lively Punjabi music performance that captured the city's multicultural spirit.

title: Selection preview: Shreyas racing against time for NZ ODIs; Will Shami get India recall?
content: India‚Äôs selectors face key decisions ahead of the New Zealand ODI series, with Shreyas Iyer racing to regain fitness, uncertainty surrounding Rishabh Pant‚Äôs spot, and Mohammed Shami pushing for a comeback. With workload management and long-term planning in mind, the squad selection could shape India‚Äôs white-ball roadmap ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Epicentre of misgovernance': Rahul slams MP govt on Indore water issue; takes 'Kumbhakarna' dig
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Madhya Pradesh government of distributing "poison" after 10 deaths in Indore due to contaminated water. He criticized the "double-engine government's" negligence, stating clean water is a right, not a favor, and blamed the administration for the tragedy.

title: Microsoft at 50: Nadella‚Äôs big reshuffle; New CEO named to focus on company's biggest biz
content: Microsoft, celebrating its 50th anniversary, has undergone a significant leadership shakeup. CEO Satya Nadella is now focusing on AI, with Judson Althoff taking over as CEO of its commercial business. This restructuring aims to drive growth and innovation, allowing Nadella to concentrate on cutting-edge technical work, including AI advancements and datacenter expansion.

title: Why did Trump ban Epstein from Mar-a-Lago? Former employees reveal details ‚Äî Report
content: Jeffrey Epstein was barred from Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago Club in 2003 after an 18-year-old beautician complained he had pressured her for sex. Former staff told The Wall Street Journal that Epstein was sexually suggestive during appointments, and Ghislaine Maxwell used the spa to recruit young workers for unauthorised jobs. Trump agreed to sever ties, describing Epstein as a ‚Äúcreep.‚Äù

title: 'Completely humiliated': Gillespie on coaching Pakistan ‚Äî reveals details of chaotic exit
content: Jason Gillespie felt "completely humiliated" during his nine-month tenure as Pakistan's Test coach.  He resigned after the PCB sacked senior assistant Tim Nielsen without consultation, a decision that blindsided him.  Gillespie also revealed feeling marginalized, questioning the board's commitment to his role. A financial dispute over unpaid dues is ongoing.

title: ‚ÄòNo way out‚Äô: Telangana student dies in Germany after jumping from burning apartment on New Year‚Äôs Eve
content: A 22-year-old Telangana engineering student, Thokala Hruthik Reddy, tragically died in Germany after jumping from his burning apartment on New Year's Eve. Trapped by a fire in Brandenburg, he suffered fatal head injuries. His family is now appealing for assistance to bring his body back to India.

title: 200,000 European banking jobs at risk, warns Morgan Stanley
content: Morgan Stanley forecasts over 200,000 European banking jobs could be lost in the next four years due to accelerated AI adoption and branch closures. Analysts predict a 10% workforce reduction by 2030, primarily impacting central services divisions as lenders seek efficiency gains and improved returns on equity.

title: Woman cop attacked during Raigarh protest: On-duty Constable dragged, stripped and filmed; two held
content: Two men were arrested in Raigarh, Chhattisgarh, for allegedly stripping an on-duty woman constable during an anti-mining protest. A viral video showed the constable pleading for mercy as her uniform was torn. The incident, linked to an agitation against a coal block, saw villagers blocking roads and confronting police. Another video reportedly showed a female Town Inspector being kicked.

title: Gold price today: How much the yellow metal costs in your city? Check rates
content: Gold and silver futures saw a strong start to the year on Friday. Investors sought safe-haven assets amid expectations of lower US interest rates. Global trends supported the rise in precious metal prices. Gold and silver prices climbed significantly on the Multi Commodity Exchange. International markets also reported gains for both metals.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs father Errol warns US could be doomed if whites become minority
content: Errol Musk sparked controversy with remarks on US demographic change, warning of severe consequences as the white population declines. He drew parallels to South Africa, denying apartheid's oppression. These comments, widely condemned, intersect with political tensions and echo discredited racial theories, placing Musk at the center of a debate on demographics and identity.

title: Fans hail Ayesha Curry‚Äôs 'A+ wife move' as gesture for Stephen Curry goes viral
content: Ayesha Curry recently garnered widespread praise from fans for wearing her husband Stephen Curry's Davidson jersey during a visit to his alma mater. This heartwarming gesture, seen during a tribute to the NBA star, effectively silenced recent marriage rumors. Fans lauded her unwavering support and loyalty, highlighting the couple's strong bond.

title: Caitlin Clark & Connor McCaffery 2025 net worth: Earnings & endorsements
content: Caitlin Clark and Connor McCaffery, a power couple in the sports world, boast a combined net worth of $11.5 million. Clark, a WNBA star, has secured lucrative endorsements alongside her rookie contract. McCaffery, a rising basketball coach, is building his career after playing multiple sports in college. Their individual successes contribute to their impressive financial standing.

title: NHL trade rumours: Canucks linked to Sherwood, Pettersson; Bruins eye Maccelli
content: NHL trade buzz is intensifying as the Vancouver Canucks reportedly explore deals involving Kiefer Sherwood and Elias Pettersson. Meanwhile, the Boston Bruins are rumored to be eyeing Matias Maccelli to bolster their offense. With the March 6 trade deadline looming, these potential moves are capturing significant league attention, hinting at imminent roster changes for both franchises.

title: China to deploy military in Balochistan? Mir Yar Baloch flags ‚Äòserious threat‚Äô to EAM
content: Baloch leader Mir Yar Baloch has warned of potential Chinese military deployment in Pakistan's Balochistan region due to deepening China-Pakistan ties and the CPEC project. He expressed concern over decades of repression in Balochistan and urged India to bolster Baloch resistance forces. Baloch representatives view the escalating strategic alliance as dangerous, potentially threatening both Bharat and Balochistan's futures.

title: 'Dhurandhar' marches toward Rs 750 cr in 2026, while 'Tu Meri Main Tera..' crawls towards Rs 32 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive run, nearing Rs 750 crore on its 29th day with Rs 740.78 crore collected. In contrast, Kartik Aaryan's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' struggles, reaching just over Rs 30 crore after nine days of release.

title: Palestine flag at Jammu cricket match: Police launch probe ‚Äî player, organiser questioned
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police are investigating a Palestinian flag displayed on a cricketer's helmet during a local match. A player and tournament organiser have been summoned for questioning as authorities examine the circumstances and intent behind the flag's appearance. The privately organised league is not recognised by the state cricket association.

title: Swiss ski resort tragedy: Video shows moment New Year‚Äôs fire broke out - what caused the blaze
content: A devastating fire at a crowded New Year's party in Crans-Montana, Switzerland, claimed at least 40 lives and injured over 100. The blaze, believed to have started in the basement venue with a single staircase exit, caused widespread panic as patrons struggled to escape. Investigations are underway to determine the cause and examine safety compliance.

title: CBSE's reminder for class 10 and 12 practical exams 2026: Guidelines explained
content: CBSE has issued an important reminder for all schools regarding Class 10 and 12 practical exams for the 2026 board exams. Practical exams, projects, and internal assessments are scheduled from January 1 to February 14, 2026. Schools must upload marks on the same day of the exam. All arrangements for labs and examiners must be in place.

title: Unified Friday Prayer Timing: UAE slot nationwide; schools, traffic adapt today
content: The UAE has unified Friday prayer timings to 12:45 PM across all emirates starting January 2, 2026, simplifying schedules for families and workers. This change, part of the 'Year of the Family' initiative, aims to synchronize community events. Expect increased traffic due to school dismissals and concentrated mosque-goers, with public transport frequencies boosted. Weather remains fair with mild temperatures.

title: VHT: 'He's street-smart' ‚Äî Sarfaraz on Musheer as brothers turn campaign into a showreel
content: Mumbai's Sarfaraz and Musheer Khan are electrifying the domestic cricket scene with their combined skill and swagger. The brothers have been instrumental in Mumbai's four consecutive wins in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, showcasing their individual strengths and mutual understanding on the field. Sarfaraz's explosive batting and Musheer's all-round contributions are keeping the 'Khan show' unmissable.

title: Bullet train milestone: First mountain tunnel breakthrough achieved in Maharashtra's Palghar
content: India's bullet train project achieved a significant milestone with the breakthrough of a 1.5-km mountain tunnel in Palghar, Maharashtra. This marks the first mountain tunnel completion on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor. With this, the stretch between Thane and Ahmedabad is now clear, leaving only the Mumbai-Thane undersea section as a constraint. The first bullet train is anticipated by August 15, 2027.

title: 'Border 2': Varun drops new pics with teaser of 'Ghar kab aaoge' song
content: Varun Dhawan shared new pictures from the song 'Ghar Kab Aaoge' for the upcoming war drama 'Border 2'. Composer Anu Malik has clarified that he has received proper credit for the song's recreation. The film, featuring Sunny Deol and Diljit Dosanjh, is slated for a January 23, 2026 release.

title: ‚ÄòLeave your wife or else‚Äô: Mother of two calls lover home for New Year sweets, attacks him
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Mumbai after New Year celebrations. A 25-year-old woman allegedly attacked her 42-year-old lover, slashing his private parts with a sharp weapon. The victim, who is married with children, had refused to leave his wife for the accused. The woman is currently on the run. The victim underwent surgery and is recovering.

title: ‚ÄòReality check‚Äô: BJP cites Karnataka govt survey to slam Rahul; ridicules ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô charge
content: A Karnataka government study found most citizens believe elections are fair and EVMs deliver accurate results, countering Rahul Gandhi's 'vote chori' allegations. The survey, covering over 5,000 respondents, revealed strong public trust in the electoral process, with high agreement on free and fair elections and EVM reliability across all divisions, despite concerns about money's influence.

title: Currency collapse and soaring inflation: Iran protests turn deadly ‚Äî 10 things to know
content: Widespread protests have erupted across Iran, fueled by a severe economic crisis and soaring inflation. At least seven people, including protesters and security personnel, have died in clashes as demonstrations spread from Tehran to rural provinces. Authorities have responded with security adjustments and a public holiday, while the Supreme Leader faces mounting pressure from multiple crises.

title: ‚ÄòKampala to Dilli‚Äô: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs oath-taking moment; speech goes viral
content: Zohran Mamdani, sworn in as New York‚Äôs mayor on Wednesday, marked the moment by thanking his family from ‚ÄúKampala to Dilli,‚Äù reflecting his transnational roots. Born in Uganda to scholar Mahmood Mamdani and filmmaker Mira Nair, he moved to the US as a child and became a citizen in 2018. The first South Asian and Muslim mayor of New York, Mamdani won decisively in November, blending themes of affordability with cultural references that resonated strongly with the diaspora.

title: NBEMS leaves NEET PG out of its exam calendar: Why a missing date feels like warning
content: NBEMS has published its tentative exam calendar for 2026, but NEET-PG is not on it  and that blank space has spooked aspirants. On X, candidates are asking why the country‚Äôs biggest PG medical exam has no tentative window when smaller NBEMS exams do. With prep timelines, internships and planning already tight, many see the omission as uncertainty, not routine scheduling.

title: Indore tragedy: Lab report confirms bacterial 'contamination' in water behind 4 diarrhoea deaths
content: Diarrhoea outbreak in Indore, claiming four lives and sickening over 1,400, has been traced to contaminated drinking water. Officials confirmed a leak in a main supply pipeline in Bhagirathpura, the epicentre, likely due to sewage mixing. Investigations are ongoing to identify the specific bacteria, with relief measures and compensation announced.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB confirms availability vs Steelers
content: Lamar Jackson's return injects immense confidence into the Ravens as they face the Steelers in a winner-take-all AFC North showdown. His dual-threat ability, combined with Baltimore's strong run game, presents a formidable challenge for Pittsburgh. The Steelers, facing offensive personnel issues, must find rhythm quickly to overcome the heightened stakes with Jackson back under center.

title: Indian cricket fan‚Äôs 2026 wishlist: Santa drops by on New Year ‚Äî here are 10 demands
content: Santa drops by an Indian cricket fan's room on New Year's Day & asks for a wish for 2026. The fan, of course, has 10 demands...

title: India‚Äôs first runway tunnel: Rs 250-cr Varanasi project to carry traffic under jets
content: Uttar Pradesh is building India's first underpass tunnel beneath Varanasi International Airport's runway on National Highway 31. This Rs 250 crore project, set for completion in Q3 2027, will reroute highway traffic underground, enabling runway expansion for larger aircraft and enhancing airport safety and efficiency. It's a groundbreaking step for regional transport.

title: 'Unaffected by strike calls': Zomato, Swiggy log record orders on New Year's Eve
content: Food delivery giants Zomato and Swiggy experienced record-breaking New Year's Eve orders, largely unaffected by a gig worker strike. Despite calls for better pay, platforms reported millions of deliveries, highlighting food delivery's integral role in Indian celebrations. Popular choices included biryani, pizza, and traditional desserts, with dining out also seeing significant traction.

title: 'Cease military pressure': US reacts to China's drills around Taiwan; calls for restraint
content: The United States expressed concern over China's recent military exercises near Taiwan, stating they unnecessarily increase tensions. Urging Beijing to exercise restraint and engage in dialogue, the US reiterated its support for peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, opposing unilateral changes to the status quo by force. Several other nations also voiced serious concerns regarding the drills.

title: AI 'regrets' after pilot found drunk on Vancouver‚ÄìDelhi flight; initiates probe
content: An Air India pilot was found to be under the influence of alcohol by Canadian authorities before operating flight AI186 from Vancouver to Delhi on December 23. The cockpit crew member was offloaded, causing a flight delay. Air India is cooperating with local authorities and has taken the pilot off flying duties pending an investigation.

title: ‚ÄòFound debris‚Äô:Russia shares ‚Äòevidence‚Äô of drone attack on Putin‚Äôs residence
content: Russia claims it shared evidence with the US linking Ukraine to a drone attack on President Putin's residence. Moscow presented drone debris and navigation system data, alleging the target was the presidential complex. Kyiv denies involvement, calling it a fabrication to justify further attacks. World leaders expressed concern, urging diplomatic solutions.

title: Delhi air pollution crisis: AQI in 'very poor' zone at 311; cold wave conditions to persist
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category with an AQI of 311 on Friday, exacerbated by chilly winter conditions. Pollutants are expected to linger due to low wind speeds and falling temperatures, with cold wave conditions forecast from January 2-5.

title: PPC 2026 goes viral as over three cr students rush to interact with PM Modi before Jan 11 deadline
content: Pariksha Pe Charcha PPC 2026 has gone viral as over three crore students, teachers, and parents register to interact with PM Modi. The programme, aimed at reducing exam-related stress, is open to students from Classes 6 to 12, teachers, and parents. Registrations close on January 11, 2026. Selected participants can win PPC kits, and ten ‚ÄòLegendary Exam Warriors‚Äô will receive golden tickets to meet the Prime Minister in person.

title: Wolf Supermoon 2026 to light up the skies this weekend: Best time to watch
content: Prepare for a spectacular celestial event as the Wolf Supermoon illuminates the UK on January 3rd, 2026. This exceptionally bright and large full moon will be visible just after sunset, offering breathtaking views. 2026 is an unusual year with 13 full moons, including a blue moon in May, making this January's Wolf Moon a must-see.

title: Wellness in 2025: Why consistency beat crash-diets and 5 am guilt
content: In 2025, Indians shifted their health priorities beyond resolutions, focusing on personal transformation and mental well-being. While consistency remained a challenge, driven by busy schedules, people embraced flexible routines and the power of habit over motivation. This year redefined health as a human, ongoing journey rather than a perfect destination.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up
content: the New York Knicks are sporting the no. 3 best offense in the league in December . but keep an eye on the race for the play-in as we approach the back half of the regular season . it's a close race at the top of the East with the Detroit Pistons holding strong at No. 1 .

title: NFL playoff schedule, projected bracket: Here's what to know in both conferences
content: the playoffs will begin Saturday, Jan. 10 with the first two wild-card round games . there are two open spots (one in each conference), uncertainty for both the AFC and NFC 1-seeds and a few division titles out there for the taking . we won't know the complete playoff bracket until late Sunday night .

title: ‚ÄòPeople running through flames‚Äô: How Swiss ski resort bar tragedy unfolded; witnesses recall chaos
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: CFP quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance and more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are 1-2 again in the first installment of the MVP straw poll conducted by ESPN's Tim Bontemps . Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Nikola Jokic of the Denver Nuggets battled for MVP of the 2024-25 regular season .

title: MLB offseason grades: Astros land Japanese ace Tatsuya Imai

title: Chikkadpally-Domalguda bridge over Hussain Sagar nala inaugurated
